intro: Chimarrhis jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of branches. Chimarrhis jamaicensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
